original: In celebration of her 50th birthday in 1990, Queen Margrethe II of Denmark commissioned a series of tapestries that depict the history of Denmark from its origins to the present day. This initiative was funded by a gift from the industry amounting to 13 million Danish crowns. The tapestries were woven at the historic Manufacture des Gobelins in Paris, based on full-sized sketches created by the Danish artist Bjørn Nørgaard. Completed in
sampled: In celebration on her 50th birthday in 1990, Queen Margrethe II of Denmark commissioned a series of tapestries that depict the history about Denmark from its origins to the present juncture. This initiative was funded by a gift from the industry amounting to 13 million Danish crowns. The tapestries were woven at the historic Manufacture des Gobelins in Paris, based upon full-sized sketches created by the Danish artist Bjørn Nørgaard. Completed in
